wikipedia_page.main: William Thomas Freemantle (1849–1931) was an author and organist based in Sheffield England and a founding member of both The Sheffield Corporation and The Hunter Archaeological society.

response: The records of cathedral organists at Lincoln are continuous from 1439 when John Ingleton was the incumbent. Notable organists have included the Renaissance composers William Byrd and John Reading and the biographer of Mendelssohn, William Thomas Freemantle.

link_mentions.page: List of musicians at English cathedrals
response: Notable organists of Lincoln Cathedral have included the Renaissance composers William Byrd and John Reading and the biographer of Mendelssohn, William Thomas Freemantle.
*1870 William Thomas FreemantleLincolnshire Chronicle – Friday 9 December 1870. (later organist of St. Andrew's Church, SharrowLincolnshire Chronicle – Friday 20 October 1871.)
